loans.use: Nayioma wants to buy 4 medium size steers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Peninah wants to wants to buy 6 medium size steers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tureto wants to build four rental rooms in Olturoto trading centre

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agnes would like to buy farm inputs i.e. fertilisers, planting seeds and farm tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace would like to build permanent rental rooms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice wants to buy one dairy cow and animal feed to boost her cows' milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sarah wants to add to her savings in order to buy a new matatu for her transport business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Loise Waithera Mwaniki intends to build five low-income rental houses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Naomi Nungari Ng’anga intends to build 2 semi-permanent houses and install electricity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rosemary would like to buy more utensils for her porridge and food stuff business and settle in a kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary Waiharo intends to build six low-income rental houses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Phyllis Mugure intends to buy a grinding machine and water storage tanks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pamela would like to buy 300 chickens and expand her chicken house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Dorcas would like to dig a water borehole

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Florence would like to buy another dairy cow and get capital to complete her dairy project

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She plans to buy more stock, especially soft drinks, cereals and other foodstuff

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Milka intends to purchase onions, tomatoes and totatoes to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Lizzy is 46 years old and a mother of 3 children. After basic education, she ventured into trading. She finally settled on the sale of 'banku,' a local favourite of most people in her community.

As a married woman, she feels her trade is directly linked to her family's survival and sustenance. She therefore looks foward to securing the KIVA loan to improve the conditions under which she works for the benefit of her numerous customers.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 38 years old and mother of 3 chidren. Though a married woman, Gladys manages a very popular pub in her commnity. Since the pub is situated in the centre of the community, patronage is very high, especially over the week-ends.

Having benefited from the 'TEACH' learning sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION, Gladys is well-positioned to render quality service to her clients. She thus wants the KIVA loan to add more seating capacity to her current level for her clients' comfort and pleasure.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rahab would like to purchase a dairy cow and animal feed for it.

loans.name: Shukria

texts.en: Shukria D/O M. A. was born in Kabul. She is married with five children, and now lives in District 5 of Kabul City. Shukria is illiterate because her family didn't give her permission to study and arranged for her to marry at a young age. Her family is going through financial crisis, so she decided to help her husband by starting an Embroidery Business. With her first loan of $175, she will buy an embroidery machine and more fabrics in order to be able to produce more stock and expand her business. She has a contract with a shop in the market that buys the clothes she makes. This provides her with an income that helps her meet her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine and fabrics

loans.name: Raesa

texts.en: Raesa has 10 years experience in tailoring. She buys cloth, threads, and other materials needed to design and sew clothes for customers in her neighborhood. She requests a loan of $175 so she can purchase an electronic sewing machine which will enable her to create more designs and clothes and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine sewing supplies

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single mother, aged 36, with 2 children to care for. She only had some basic education and began a beverage/snack-bar some 5 years ago. She operates the establishment mostly in the mornings and evenings.

The greater part of her sales are generated at night since port workers partonise the establishment after 10:00 p.m. daily. Rose wants to access the KIVA loan to acquire a 4-burner gas cooker, cylinder, new frying pans, and cups to serve her customers.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab D/O S. H. lives in District 5 of Kabul City. She is married and has five Children. During the wars in Afghanistan, she immigrated to Pakistan. In Pakistan she was living in a very difficult condition so she returned to Afghanistan. Her family suffered financially, because her husband was jobless for a year and her children weren't able to go to school.  Her husband found a job, but the family needed further support, so she started a tailoring business in her home. Zainab requests a loan of $175 to buy an electric sewing machine and fabrics which will enable her to make fine clothes more quickly and earn more income. She is understands the loan process and is happy to have an opportunity to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine, fabrics and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to renovate her rental houses and add stock to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Felicina would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 34 years and a single mother of 3 children. She had education up to the vocational level and specialised in textile works. Currently she runs her own sewing notions shop in a busy suburb of the city. Items for sale include colour designs, zips, thread, and calico.

Having gone through the 'TEACH' sessions of KRABAN, she is poised to add other items that are in demand as well. She hopes the KIVA loan would make this expansion a reality.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Shukria

texts.en: Shukria is 35 years old and lives in District 14 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is the mother of five children. She requests a loan for $175, which will be used to buy the wood, flour and new baking equipment she needs to grow her business and earn more income. She works very hard to bring positive changes to her life and to support her family economically.

loans.use: To buy wood, flour and new baking equipment

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa D/O S. H. is married and lives in District 5 of Kabul City. Sharifa is an uneducated women, and she helps her family by running a carpet weaving business with the help of her children. When she first started her business, she didn't have the right materials to make enough carpets. Her work progressed slowly, and she could only make one or two carpets a year. She decided to participate in the loan program, which enabled her to buy the materials she needed to produce more carpets. Now she has completed her first loan cycle, and requests a second loan for $175 so she can make 4-6 carpets a year and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase materials to increase her carpet production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her retail-cake business by buying more wheat flour and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Benedette would like to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba D/O M. A. is married, has four children and lives in District 5 of Kabul City. She was in high school when the war broke out and that kept her from completing her education. The wars had a very bad impact on her financial situation and her life got worse day by day. In order to improve her family's finances, she took out her first loan to buy clothes for her sons to sell in the market and streets of Kabul City. Before the loan, only one of her sons was doing business, which made it difficult to overcome their financial problems. Her first loan made it possible to buy more clothes so two of her sons could work and earn money. She is requesting a second loan of $175 so she and her sons can continue to increase their income and opportunities to do business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is 30 years old and is the mother of six children. She has eight years experience in the dairy business. She is requesting a loan of $175 to buy another cow in order to produce more yogurt, cheese, and butter to sell in the baazar. This will increase her income and help her to better take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and livestock feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Robina would like to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ruth would like to buy more cereal food, milk, and vegetables.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 28 years old and married with 2 children. She had her education in Takoradi up to junior school. She followed with a vocation in the textile sector. Her specialisation is the use of chemicals in dyeing cloth to give it a new colour altogether.

Nancy supplies her cloth to schools, private organisations, and individuals as well, both within and beyond the city.

Nancy 'graduated' from the 'TEACH' sessions facilitated by KRABAN in October 2006. Her objective is to use the KIVA loan to acquire a shop in which to display and sell her 'tie/dye' cloth.

loans.use: Structure Construction

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Everlyn would like to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Noor Zai

texts.en: Noor Zai is 32 years old with a household of five. He lives in District 17 Kabul, Afghanistan. Noor Zai has been in the taxi business for seven years. He works seven days a week to earn income to support his family. In order to keep his taxi in good operating order, he needs to buy new tires and tubes, so he is requesting a loan of $175.

loans.use: To purchase new tires and tubes for taxi

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Thuan was born in 1975. She sells fruits and vegetables at the local market. Thuan’s husband is a farmer who has 1500 square meters of land, where he has been growing vegetables for 6 years. They have a daughter and a son. The daughter is a ninth grade student and the son is a second grade student. Their income is $10 per person/month. It is difficult for them to keep their children in school. They need a loan for $75 in order for them to purchase various fruits and vegetables for the shop and to continue growing vegetables on their land. They are going to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for her shop at the local market.

loans.name: Aghayeva

texts.en: N. is a resident of Beylagan town. She is 27 years old and started her business two years ago. She rents a shop in the center of town where she sells different food stuff. In the beginning of her business she borrowed first $300 then $500 for increasing the stock of goods. Thus she developed her business and now she needs $600 to buy a refrigerator to store diary, meat and other products.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba is 36 years and completed basic education. She is a single mother with 2 children. Having tried with various trades, she finally settled on the preparation of a local drink made from ginger, pepper, spices, and sugar. This is refrigerated before sale, though some also like to consume it hot. The local name of the drink is 'lomogye' or 'Hausa beer'.

As a beneficiary of the KRABAN learning sessions, Abiba wants the KIVA loan to acquire a deep freeze to store the drinks before selling them next day.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther intends to expand her fruit/vegetable business and to fund the family furniture business.

loans.name: Allahverdiyev

texts.en: S. is Internally Displace Person from the Armenian-occupied Khojavand region. Now he and his family are settled in the Beylagan region. When they were relocated, his family faced many hardships and he was earning his living through cattle breeding in which they were traditionally engaged in their homeland. He borrowed four loans from Normicro Beylagan branch, first in the amount of $300 and finally $600. He bought calves, raised, and sold them. Now he needs $700 to buy one more cow and also sheep.

loans.use: To buy one cow and 5 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary W. Mbuchu intends to construct two new permanent rental rooms.

loans.name: Bayramova

texts.en: U. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Armenian-occupied Fizuli region of Azerbaijan. She is 29 and she is settled in Beylagan together with her family. She has four children. She has been engaged in cattle breeding and selling since 2004. It is traditional and profitable business in rural areas. She borrowed three loans from Normicro Beylagan branch, first for $300 and finally $700. She needs $1000 to buy ten calves, raise them and sell them.

loans.use: To buy ten calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mercy would like to start a small business of selling beauty items, lessos, sandals, blouses and tops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Shania wants to expand her business by buying large quantities of beads of different varieties.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 32 years and a single mother of 3 children. She had basic education. She is presently engaged in the food distribution chain.

Mercy purchases maize, beans, and groundnuts from Techiman, a major cereal market in the middle part of the country, for resale in Takoradi. The market appears very promising, looking at her sales records over the last 6 months.

Mercy anticipates using the KIVA loan to increase the number of sacks that she brings back per trip. In this way, she hopes to meet the needs of her clients better.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Dadashova

texts.en: E. is 48 years old and a resident of Beylagan region. She has been engaged in sheep breeding together with her family since 2005. When she started the business, she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch where she borrowed first $300 then $400. She breeds sheep and her husband sells them in the market, or delivers them to butchery shops. Having a good repayment history, now she applies for $600 to buy more sheep and expand the business.

loans.use: To buy ten sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy larger quantities of commodities to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Simiton wants to buy beads, belts, bags and other materials, which act as base material where beads are attached.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Evelyn would like to buy iron sheets, timber, nails, stones and cement to put up a room for her retail shop.

loans.name: Hasanov

texts.en: Y. is a resident of Beylagan town in Azerbaijan. He is 28 years old, married with three children. Last year he started his business of selling food stuff. He has his self-built small shop. He wants to increase his volume of sales in the shop, and include meat and diary products, and therefore applies for $500 from Normicro for the first time.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Kakuu would like to buy six steers.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a single mother of 2 children and 24 years old. She was educated to the senior school level. Pressing family needs denied her the opportunity to continue from there.

With her father's help, she has set up a small pub in her community. However, notwithstanding the good patronage she enjoys, she is adversely restricted by the number of crates she can afford to purchase at one time.

Vera would therefore be glad if KIVA could assist her with the loan required to support her capital investment.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Angela would like to buy 7 young steers for her new business

loans.name: Kerimov

texts.en: G. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Khojavand region of Azerbaijan, now under occupation by Armenian forces. He and his family of his wife and four children were relocated to the Beylagan region. Since 2004, he has been engaged in cattle breeding and sales, which is quite a profitable business in rural areas. When he started the business he borrowed $300 from Normicro Beylagan branch as an initial capital to buy calves. Later he borrowed two more loans. Now he needs new loan in amount of $900 to buy livestock.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Emily would like to increase stock of necklaces, bracelets, belts, and bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Kamasek would like to buy 8 steers

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Eddie is 38 years old, unmarried, and has no children. He had education through a technical institution, but he has decided to go into retail trading.

Eddie operates a mini general store at a large heavy-haulage terminal in the city. The area is crowded with trucks carting cocoa to the port of Takoradi. Eddie is in need of funds to purchase the range of merchandise that the drivers and their attendants need daily. He therefore looks forward to obtaining a loan from KIVA to assist in this direction.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mahmudov

texts.en: F. is a 52 year-old local resident of Beylagan town. He is trading fruit and vegetables in the market place. He has been engaged in this business since 2003. He has his own car to transport goods. Since the start of his business, he borrowed four loans from Normicro Beylagan branch, first $300, and finally $600. He used the loans to increase the stock of goods and expanding the business. Now he needs $700 for the same purpose.

loans.use: To increase the stock of inventories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to cover the cost of buying good quality cows

loans.name: Mammadov

texts.en: S. is a resident of Beylagan town. He is 27 years old, married with two children. Since 2005, he has been engaged in cattle breeding. He built a shed in his yard where he breeds cattle and sells them. This type of business is usual in rural areas. Each season he sells or slaughters 2-3 cattle. He borrowed three loans from Normicro Beylagan branch since he started the business. Now he needs $700 to buy 15 sheep and breed sheep as well.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Salydia would like to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Julie is 48 years old and married with 4 children. She had no formal education but manages a popular spot that provides catering services to residents of the haulage terminal. Her work sometimes goes deep into the night since some drivers arrive late and must be attended to.

As a recent beneficiary of KRABAN'S learning sessions, Julie sees the KIVA loan as a major boost to her business. She would like to take full advantage and accordingly provide quality service to her clients.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of cereals by buying in large quantities

loans.name: Mammadova

texts.en: V. is a resident of Beylagan town. She has three children. Together with her husband she built a small shop in 2005 and started the business of selling products for daily use. When she started the business she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed three loans, in the amounts of $400 and $500. For these loans she bought inventories to be sold in the shop. Now she needs $500 to buy a new counter stand.

loans.use: To buy a new counter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Emily would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Yagubova

texts.en: R. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fizuli region of Azerbaijan, now under occupation of Armenian armed forces. She and her family of her husband and three children were relocated to the  Beylagan region. She is engaged in cattle breeding together with her husband. Since 2004, they have borrowed three loans from Normicro Beylagan branch, first $300, then $500 and $700. They buy calves, raise them and sell them. This is their only source of earning a living. Now she needs $800 to buy two cows to produce calves and sell diary products as well.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more household goods and foodstuff for her business

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Sala is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She schooled up to the junior level. Having sold around for some time, she decided to settle in the family house and ply her trade by selling general provisions. She took advantage of a store room in the family house to display her wares.

Sala is seeking the KIVA loan to stock up on goods that are in demand in her community. It is her firm hope that this will go a long way toward improving the well-being of her family.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is mother of 5 children and 32 years old. She supports her husband in the upkeep of the family by selling cooked rice and stew in front of the family house.

Vida has had no formal education and therefore views the KRABAN 'TEACH' learning sessions as a great opportunity to improve her lot. She thinks that it is a window of great hope and would like to access the KIVA loan to change the environment in which she operates.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Tu

texts.en: Tu is married to Than. Both Tu and Than were born in 1962. They live with their son who is in the ninth grade at a local school. They don’t have any land aside from 20 square meters for their home. Tu’s husband must work as a labourer in his village. Tu has a small shop where she sells some fruits and vegetables. Their main income, which comes from selling fruits and vegetables, is only $10 per person/month. Because of low capital, Tu isn't able to purchase various fruits and vegetables in order to improve her income. Tu wants to get a loan of $75 so that she will be able to purchase various fruits and vegetables for her shop. Tu believes that she is going to repay monthly.

loans.use: To increase the variety of fruits and vegetables for her shop.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustie is 52 years old and married with 4 children who are all in school. She runs a small stationery supplies shop close to a cluster of schools in the metropolis. Items such as confectionary, packaged snacks, and water are also available in her shop. Schools are on holiday now but will be reopening in May for the final semester of the year.

Faustie would like to access the KIVA loan to purchase additional stocks for when schools come on stream in a month's time.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Mrs. Antonia C. has a business in which she sells roasted chicken, meals and refreshments. This business is located in the Villa Nuevo Potosi neighborhood, on a hillside to the East of the city of La Paz. She has three married daughters who help her with taking care of her lodgings. She is 53 years of age, and has more than 15 years of experience in developing her business. Her sales and the preparation of meals take place daily, and if there is a surplus, it is used by relatives and the family. She has been a client of Impro since April of 2000. Her history with our institution qualifies her as a number one client, which is to say she has an excellent record of paying her obligations. The amount asked for is intended for the wholesale purchase of items such as potatos, rice and salsas, with the objective of lowering operating costs. Her work and previous dealings with Impro gives her access to this credit since she has experience in her business which provides income to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Dwight Davis, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La Sra. Antonia, tiene un negocio donde vende pollo broster, comida y refrescos, el cual se halla ubicado en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí (Ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz). Tiene tres hijas que están casadas y le ayudan en la atención de la pensión. Tiene 53 años y tiene experiencia en el desarrollo de su trabajo de más de 15 años. Sus ventas y elaboración de comida son al día y si existe excedente es para el consumo familiar. Es cliente de Impro, desde abril del año 2000. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento excelente en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de insumos (papa, arroz, refrescos, salsas) al por mayor con el objetivo de abaratar costos operativos. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en: Zahid N. (employee pictured) owns a successful auto repair shop in the small town of Khachmaz, which is located on the Northeast coast of Azerbaijan. Zahid is looking for funding so that he can purchase items for his shop so that he can remain competitive. He would like to purchase auto paint, auto parts and tools.

loans.use: To purchase auto paint, auto parts and toold for his shop.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Aggie is 37 years old and mother of 4 children. She had only basic education. She supports the upkeep of the family with the sale of used clothes in her community and in the villages outside the metropolis.

Since she has very little capital, Aggie has to contend with the very low grades of clothing available to her. Having gone through the KRABAN learning sessions, she is determined to use the KIVA loan to buy two full bales of used clothes for a start. She also hopes to find others who would buy from her for onward resale.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Auntie

texts.en:
Auntie is 50 years old with no formal education. She has 4 children who are grown-ups and fending for themselves. She prepares kenkey for sale in her community and beyond. Maize, the primary ingredient of kenkey, is Auntie's major concern. Most often she has to buy the maize for her kenkey on credit and pay back upon sale in 2 weeks. This situation erodes her profit margin greatly.

Auntie wants the KIVA loan to purchase the maize upfront and thereby retain a higher percentage of her profits and also reduce the workload that goes with her business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 34 years old and married with 3 children. She attended school up to the senior secondary level. She settled on assisting her husband in running the hardware store they operate in the community.

Currently Nancy manages the store alone since her husband is in employment elsewhere. Items for sale include fabricated coal pots, wire nets, and nails and other carpentry tools.

Nancy intends to use the KIVA loan to increase the range of products available for sale in their store.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is not married and has two children. She lives in Buza area in Dar es Salaam. Amina owns a small canteen near the Dar es Salaam Harbour. She sells cold drinks, breakfast and lunch to mostly harbour workers. Amina has received entrepreneurship and business training from Hans Said Foundation and Equal Oportunities Trust Fund (EOTF) in Dar es Salaam.

During working hours her business is normally very busy with customers. She needs to expand her business by adding dining chairs and tables, food serving dishes and stock of cold drinks.

To facilitate this expansion she is in need of USD 1000 as a working capital. Amina’s dream is to one day have a professional catering business.

loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with three children. She lives in the outskirts of Dar es Salaam (Capital city of Tanzania) where water supply is irregular. She dug a well about twelve months ago. She sells water to her neighbors and nearby communities. She currently use a bucket to fetch water from the Well.

She needs an additional capital of USD 1200 to buy an electrical pump and two storage tanks to effectively run her business. Tanks will act as a reservoirs and water treatment points. Water is very important in her area due to usual cholera and amoebic dysentery outbreaks. Dar es Salaam is now in the rainy season.

loans.use: PURCHASE AN ELECTRICAL PUMP AND STORAGE TANKS

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 27-year-old mother, married with 3 children. She has had no education at all. As a young woman she began to prepare local rice for sale to the inhabitants of her community. Over time, she has enjoyed good patronage and therefore changed to imported rice since customer preference shifted in favour of that. Her patrons include little children and adults as well.

With her participation in KRABAN'S learning sessions, Nana seeks the KIVA loan to put up a small shed under which she can serve her customers.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura is married with three children. She lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. She has attended Business and entrepreneurship training offered by Youth Self Employment Foundation (YOSEFO). She owns a stall at Tandika market selling used clothes. She purchases these clothes from wholesalers and resell them in retail.

Using her savings, she managed to start keeping egg-laying hens as a supplementary business. She came to notice that the second business needs more capital than she anticipated.

To smoothly run her two businesses she needs USD 750 as capital. The money will be used to buy chicken feed, some medications and stock of clothes.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Connie is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She has had no education at all. Presently, she supplements the family income with the running of a food sales joint. She fries yams and plantains in front of the family house. The combination of fried fish pepper (shito) makes a special delicacy for young and old as well.

Connie's intention is to use the KIVA loan to buy the best quality of yams and plantains and fry them for her loyal customers.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ayubu

texts.en:
M. lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. He is married with three children. He keeps egg-layers and broiler chickens on his farm. He need to expand the number of birds in his flock. The need of increase in birds number is the rise on demand of eggs and broilers after he recently obtained a tender to supply eggs and chicken meat in various restaurants in Ilala districts. The increase in birds number goes along with the increase in the size of chicken huts.

M. is in need of USD 1000 to execute his expansion plan. M. also grows vegetables which he sells on wholesale to food vendors and other retailers. He uses birds droppings as manure for the vegetables.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is married with six children. He lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. Charles keeps cows and chickens as his business. He supplies milk and eggs to retailers. He is in a plan to increase the flock of animals especially broilers. In addition to animal keeping Charles grows vegetables and fruits of which he sells in wholesale and in retail. Droppings from animals are used as manure to the farm.

He needs USD 750 to buy some insecticide for treating his farm and increase the flock of chickens. Charles has expectations that one day he will become a big supplier of farm products.

loans.use: Buy insecticide and chickens

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
Donalds lives in Buza area, on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam. He owns a vegetable and fruits stall where he sells different fruits and vegetables. He buys some of the fresh produce like tomatoes and spinach from local farmers nearby his residence. He also buys other farm produce like oranges, bananas and pineapples from nearby regions.

Donald need to expand his business to meet a rising demand from his clients. He is planning to buy baskets to protect and display his produce. He also planning to purchase a bicycle to help him fetch some locally produced produce from nearby areas. To make these purchases he is in need of USD 750.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for produce stand

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en: Kamran N. (employee pictured) is a farmer on the outskirts of the small town of Khachmaz, located on the Northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Karman wants to invest in his farm by purchasing more trees and to hire another farm hand to help him with the tractor work.

loans.use: To purchase trees and to hire an employee to help with tractor work

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Yombo, on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children. Two in primary school and one in secondary school. Elizabeth owns a small pharmacy near her residence selling human medications. She has been in this business for seven years and her business is licensed by the authorities.

She frequently faced with shortage of medications for malaria and water contamination diseases like cholera, typhoid and parasites. The situation is intense especially during the rainy season, occurring now in Dar es Salaam. She is in need of USD 750 to replenish her stock.

loans.use: Buy medications for pharamacy

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is 38 years old with no children. She has basic education. She began trading early in life and has managed to open a snack joint in front of her house. She also sells items like sachet beverages, confectionaries, and toiletries. She sells meat pies with soft drinks.

Having taken part in the 'TEACH' learning sessions of KRABAN, Gina wants the KIVA loan to erect a structure to securely display her wares.

loans.use: Structure Acquisition

loans.name: Namkik

texts.en: Namik S. owns a small market in the small town of Khachmaz, located on the Northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Namik is looking for funding so that he can increase the quantity and variety of his inventory in order to remain competitive and increase his customer base.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of his inventory.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with four children. She lives in Kijichi area in Dar es Salaam. The area has no reliable water supply. By the help of her husband and her own savings she managed to buy a water tank and an electric pump. The demand for water is very high due to house construction going on in the area. Apart from construction, water is also highly needed for normal domestic uses by people in her neighborhood.

She is in need of USD 1000 to buy another tank to act as a treatment point and reservoir for water.

loans.use: Purchase of water tank

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is a big-time businesswoman who deals in General Merchandise in her locality at Jogis Estates in Ghana. She supplies household items including beverages to a lot of customers in her vicinity.

Matilda is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has benefited from the TEACH lending program since 1997. She requires a KIVA loan of $975 to improve her business.

loans.use: Working CAPITAL

loans.name: Felichesm

texts.en:
M. lives in Vituka area in Dar es Salaam. He owns a shop selling different consumable items. He aims at increasing the stock of soft drinks. Soft drinks have high turnover in his shop. The demand for soft drinks in Dar es Salaam is high because of the weather - it is hot throughout the year. The profit margin of soft drinks, mainly Pepsi cola are high if a retailer buys more than 50 crates at a time.

The loan requested will enable M. to buy in quantities that will make his business profitable. He is asking for a loan of US$ 1000.

loans.use: Buy stock for soft drink business

loans.name: Isack

texts.en:
Isack lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. He is married and has six children. Two of his sons are in secondary school. Isack keeps chickens and cows. Alongside keeping animals, Isack grows vegetables. He uses manures from animals for vegetables growing. He has been in this dual business for five years now. Isack is worried in this coming rain season since animals and vegetables are frequently attacked by deseases during the rains.

He need a sufficient stock of insectcides. He couldn’t managed buy these items by himself because he recently paid school fees for his elder son. Isack is in need of USD 750 to buy enough stock of insecticides to protect his animals and vegetables.

loans.use: Buy insecticide to protect livestock and crops

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
María is a single mom with a 16 year old daughter and a 15 year old son. She also takes care of her elderly mother. She started her business five years ago, sewing and selling costume jewelry. She chose this work because it allowed her to have a more flexible schedule, so she could spend more time with her mother and take better care of her children. Both of her children are studying and they help María in any way that they can.

Lately, María's has had more work as well as more demand for her products. This is why she needs a $275 loan; she'll use the money to buy more costume jewelry and material she needs to continue sewing. María would like to see her business grow, because this means a better support for her family and that her children will be able to finish their studies. She needs your support and is sincerely thankful to you for any help you can offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria es madre soltera de una hija de 16 años y un hijo de 15, además se hace cargo de su mamá que es una persona de edad avanzada. Desde hace cinco años se dedica al negocio de costura y a la venta de bisutería, por que esto lo podía realizar en horarios más flexibles, que le permitieran pasar más tiempo con su madre y atender mejor a sus hijos. Sus dos hijos están estudiando y colaboran con el negocio de Maria en lo que les es posible.

Últimamente para Maria el trabajo se ha incrementado, igual que la demanda por sus productos, por lo que requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 275 dólares que empleara en la compra de mercancía de bisutería y artículos que requiere para la costura. Maria tiene muchos deseos de crecer porque sabe que de esta manera podrá ayudar a su familia, y sus hijos podrán concluir sus estudios, es por eso que necesita de tu apoyo y agradece sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas ofrecerle.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en: Zaur P. (employee pictured) owns an audio cassette and CD stand in the small town of Khachmaz, located on the Northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Zaur is looking for funding so that he can increase the quantity and variety of music he offers to his customers. Zaur also would like to invest in newer and bigger displays for his new inventory.

loans.use: To purchase displays as well as increase his inventory of audio cassettes and CDs

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is married with three children. He lives in Kiwalani area in Dar es Salaam. He sells vegetable and fruits near his residence. He buys fresh produce from nearby villages for resale. The business has been his main source of livelihood for the past ten years. He has had difficulty growing the business because he has to balance the business and his family obligations. If his business is expanded, he will be able to meet the challenge of paying school fees for his child who is expected to start secondary education. The business provides a source of employment for her wife too.

The proposed loan will help Leonard expand his business through adding up new products, like rice, beans, maize flour, millet, sorghum, groundnuts and the like. The amount needed to expand his business is USD 1000.

loans.use: Expand fruit and vegetable stand

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame is 37 years old and married with 5 children. Her education ended at basic level. She supports the family income with profits from her 'gari/beans' food joint.

Maame has operated this joint for well over 6 years now. Her desire is to improve the eating environment of her customers. Thus she seeks to use the KIVA loan to construct a shed and fill it with plastic tables and chairs for the convenience of her patrons.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Kitunda area in Dar es Salaam. She is not married and has two children - one in primary school and another in secondary school. Maria keeps egg laying hens and broilers near her residence. She would like to expand her business to enable her to pay for school fees for her secondary school children and increase income for her family.

She plans to increase the size of her flock from 400 to 600 chickens. Maria will hire one person in her business to take charge of the increased stock. Her expansion plan needs additional funding to buy the chicks along with stock of poultry feed, medications and expand the existing chicken hut. To implement her growth plan she need additional capital of USD 1000.

loans.use: Expand poultry business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is married and has a 16 year old daughter and a 11 year old son. Her husband operates heavy machinery in Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo León, where both come from. Household expenses started to rise because the children began to attend school, and the salary Delia's husband was getting was not enough to cover for all these expenses. This is why six years ago, Delia started to sell jewelry with the help of a relative. As her business started to grow, she decided to become independent. Now she has a successful business selling jewelry, and she works alone because she wants her children to dedicate their time solely to their studies.

To keep pace with the growing demand, Delia needs a $375 loan to buy merchandise and make her business grow. You can be an important part of this growth, Delia is thankful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Delia es casada y tiene una hija de 16 años y un hijo de 11, su esposo trabaja como operador de maquinaria pesada en la localidad de Sabinas Hidalgo, del estado de Nuevo León, de donde ambos son originarios. Los gastos en el hogar empezaron a incrementarse por motivo de los estudios de sus hijos y el salario de su esposo se volvió insuficiente, fue así como hace seis años Delia comenzó con la venta de joyería, ayudándole a una familiar, pero después comenzó a tener más clientes y decidió independizarse. Ahora ella vende sus propios productos y tiene un negocio que ha sacado adelante durante este tiempo, en el cual trabaja ella sola porque quiere que sus hijos se dediquen por completo a sus estudios.

Para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes Delia necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que empleara en la compra de mercancía, y para poder crecer con su negocio. Tú puedes ser parte importante en este crecimiento, Delia agradece tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Apolonio

texts.en:
During the last five years, Apolonio has dedicated hismelf to the sale of groceries, in order to support his family's education. He is married is has tree sons. His wife is his right-handed man in the store; she helps him with administration duties. It has not been easy to maintain this business during so much time, but because the family works very hard, Apolonio managed to expand his grocery business. Ultimately, Apolonio and his family had difficult times and were presented with unexpected expenses, which impeded the supply for his business. This is why he is asking for a loan of $925 for the purchase of merchandise (groceries).

Apolonio is a hard working and responsible man, who knows that his family depends on this business and needs your help in order to support them and get through this crisis. He has confidence that his business will enable him to push ahead because he works very hard. You can contribute to improving the lives of his family members, they do not need much, and sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace quince años, el señor Apolonio se dedica a las ventas de abarrotes, esto lo hizo para poder darle sustento y educación a su familia, él es casado y tiene tres hijos. Su esposa es su brazo derecho en su negocio, ella le ayuda en atender y administrar el abarrote. No ha sido fácil mantenerse en el negocio durante tanto tiempo, pero con la unión de la familia y un trabajo arduo, Apolonio lo ha logrado y ha visto crecer su abarrote. Últimamente Apolonio y su familia pasan por momentos difíciles y se le han presentado gastos imprevistos, esto le impidió surtir su negocio, por lo que solicita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 925 dólares para la compra de mercancía.

Apolonio es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, sabe que de este negocio depende su familia y necesita de tu ayuda para poder sostenerlo y salir de esta crisis, él confía en que su negocio podrá salir adelante porque esta dispuesto a trabajar muy duro. Tú puedes contribuir a mejorar la vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchasing perishable goods

loans.name: Maulid

texts.en:
Maulid lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. He is married with four children of which two are in primary school other two are in secondary school. Maulid sells fresh fish in retail. He has to wake up very early in the morning everyday, go to the shores of Indian Ocean and buy fish from fishermen. He resell these fish in Tandika market.

Maulid want to improve his business by having enough working capital to purchase a large amount of fish. The profit margin for fish selling is small but he can improve it by having enough stock of fish. Since fish business is perishable Maulid is planning to buy some equipments which together with ice blocks can help keep the fish fresh until evening. Ice blocks are bought from Ice suppliers. Maulid is in need of USD 550 to make his plan work.

loans.use: Equipment to improve fish selling business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Twenty years ago Josefina started her store with the help of her husband and children. She is a ery hard working and active person and has watched her business grow little by little. Sadly, her husband died and josefina is working her her store alone. She currently is receiving financial help from her children but Josefina wants to continue with her business. She doesn't have enough money to invest in merchandise. In order to do this, she needs a loan of $650.

For Josefina, it is difficult to start again without her husband. She knows that with her children's help, she can continue on with her business. You can help Josefina in these difficult times when she needs help and care. She sincerely thanks you for any help you can give.

Hace veinte años, L. señora Josefina inició su negocio D. abarrotes con ayuda D. su esposo y D. sus hijos, elL. es una persona muy activa y trabajadora, y ha visto crecer su negocio poco a poco. Lamentablemente murió su esposo y elL. se quedó soL. al frente D. su tienda, ahora recibe el apoyo económico D. sus hijos, pero elL. quiere continuar con su negocio, no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para surtirse D. mercancía, por lo que necesita D. un préstamo por L. cantidad D. $ 650 dólares que empleara con este fin.

Para Josefina es difícil iniciar D. nuevo sin su esposo, pero con L. ayuda D. sus hijos sabe que podrá sacar adelante su negocio. Tú puedes ayudar a Josefina en estos momentos difíciles, elL. necesita D. tu apoyo y cariño, y agradece sinceramente toda L. ayuda que puedas brindarle.

loans.use:
Purchase Merchandise

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Mayunga

texts.en:
Mayunga is married with three children. He lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. He sells vegetable and fruits near his residence. He buys fresh produce from nearby villages for resale at a small profit. The business has been the main source of livelihood for he and his family for the past five years. If his business is expanded, he will be able to meet the challenge of paying school fees for his two children. His business has had trouble growing because of limited capital.

The proposed loan will allow Mayunga to expand his business through adding new products. The amount need to expand his business is USD 550.

loans.use: Expand business selling fresh produce

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is an enterprising young woman with an enormous desire to get ahead. She used to work in a clothing store and saved up in order to become independent. When she was able to save up a small amount of capital, she decided to invest it in her own business and so she started selling clothes from her home two years ago. Lately her number of customers has increased and her sales have greatly improved. She wants her business to grow and be successful, so she is ready to work very hard. She needs a loan of $650.00, which will help her to invest in more merchandise, so that she can offer more variety and thereby remain perferred by her customers.

You can be an important part of the growth of this business. Maria pledges to repay the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. This young woman’s dream is in your hands, decide to support her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elena es una joven emprendedora y con enormes deseos de superación, ella trabajaba en un almacén de ropa y fue ahorrando para independizarse, cuando logró juntar un pequeño capital decidió invertirlo en su propio negocio e inició con la venta de ropa hace dos años, en su propio domicilio. Actualmente sus clientes se han incrementado y sus ventas se han mejorado mucho. Ella quiere que su negocio pueda crecer y ser exitoso, y para ello esta dispuesta a trabajar arduamente, solo necesita de un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que le ayudara a invertir en más mercancía, para poder ofrecer más variedad y poder permanecer en la preferencia de sus clientes.

Tú puedes formar parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, Mary se compromete a regresar el préstamo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses, esta en tus manos el sueño de esta joven, no lo dudes y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Zumrud

texts.en: Zumrud M. (employee pictured) owns a “1001 things for the home” store in the small town of Khachmaz, located on the Northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. These types of stores are common throughout Azerbaijan. She would like to increase the variety of items that her store offers in order to differentiate herself from the competition.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of her store.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is from Mérida, Yucatán. She is married and has two daughters who are 22 and 24 years old. Eleven years ago, Jacinta began selling food in order to help her husband with household expenses and her daughters’ schooling. Her husband is a laborer and the income he received was very little. She began with a small stove and just a few kitchen implements, but her business has grown and, little by little, she has been improving her kitchen and he has gained the liking of her clients. Both of her daughters now help her and she wishes to see her business grow.

At this time, Jacinta needs a loan in the amount of $700.00, which she will use to buy ingredients she needs to make the foods she sells. Become a part of the growth of this business and help this family make it grow. You can collaborate with them, have no doubts.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Jacinta es originaria de Mérida, Yucatán, es casada y tiene dos hijas, de 22 y 24 años. Hace once años que Jacinta inició con la venta de comida para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y con los estudios de sus hijas, porque él es obrero y el salario que recibía era muy poco. Inició con una pequeña estufa y con pocos accesorios, pero su negocio ha ido creciendo y poco a poco ha ido acondicionando el lugar, y se ha colocado en el gusto de sus clientes, ahora cuenta con la ayuda de sus dos hijas y desea que su negocio pueda crecer.

En estos momentos, Jacinta necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 700 dólares que empleara en la compra de insumos que necesita para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende. Forma parte de este crecimiento y ayuda a esta familia a hacer crecer su negocio, tu puedes colaborar con esta familia, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina lives in Buza area, on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children. She sells maize flour to food vendors. She prepares the flour by herself. She buys the maize in retail, sends it to the milling machine and pack the product in packets of 5-10 kilograms each. She also sell leftover maize as animal feed.

She is planning to increase her stock of maize so she can avoid running out, a frequent problem. To meet her goal she needs a loan of USD 550.

loans.use: Expand business selling maize flour.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Estela has four children and to improve their quality of life, she began her own business selling groceries two years ago in the city of Mérida, Yucatán, which is where she is from. She had very little savings, but little by little she stocked her store. Now her number of clients has grown and they demand products to which she doesn’t have access because of the small amount of capital she has to invest in the business. In order to fulfill the demand from her customers she is requesting a loan in the amount of $275.00, which she will use to have a greater variety of products and thereby keep her customers.

Maria Estela is ready to work very hard in order to get ahead in this business. She just needs your support and warmth. Your help will be of great use to this family. Have no doubt, they will sincerely appreciate your collaboration.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Estela tiene cuatro hijos y para mejorar su calidad de vida, hace dos años inició su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes en la ciudad de Mérida, Yucatán de donde es originaria. Ella tenía pocos ahorros y poco a poco fue surtiendo su abarrote, ahora sus clientes se han incrementado y demandan más productos a los que ella no tiene acceso por el poco capital que ha invertido, para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes solicita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener mas variedad de productos y permanecer en el gusto de sus clientes.

Maria Elena esta dispuesta a trabajar arduamente para sacar adelante este negocio, sólo necesita de tu apoyo y cariño, tu ayuda será de gran utilidad para esta familia. No lo dudes más, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu colaboración.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Naana

texts.en: Naana is 40 years old and a single mother with 1 child. She had only basic education. She procures palm fruits from villages and processes them into palm oil in her house. She produces the palm oil with traditional methods of processing for the past 5 years and thinks she loses a lot. She therefore intends to use the KIVA loan to procure some basic tools like a fruit press to reduce the loss and the drudgery that goes with it.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is married with four children. She lives in Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam. Her two sons are in secondary school. Rosemary is self employed and own a shop near her residence. The shop sells different consumable items, mainly food items which are in high demand. The shop provides her with an opportunity to raise her children.

She would like to expand her business so that she can meet the costs of educating her children. The shop employs herself and her sister. To expand her business she needs USD 750.

loans.use: Expand shop selling food and other consumables.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Mrs. Aurelia is married and has three children. Her husband is retired and three years ago she began selling fried foods from her house. Later, she began selling food that her neighbors and friends ordered from her. She realized that with this type of food she could have better profits and decided to get into that business. Now Aurelia needs a loan in the amount of $200.00, which she will use to buy the ingredients she needs to make her products. She hopes to increase the types of foods she makes so that she can offer a better variety to her customers so that they will continue to prefer her business.

Aurelia is a very hardworking woman who wants to make her business grow. She offers to repay the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. You can help Aurelia, you can be an important part of the growth of this business. Your help will be a great blessing.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Aurelia es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo es pensionado y hace tres años inició vendiendo tostadas y frituras en su casa, después incorporó la venta de comidas que le encargaban sus vecinos y amigos, se dio cuenta de que con las comidas podía obtener mayores beneficios y decidió incursionar en este negocio. En estos momentos Aurelia requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares que utilizara para la compra de ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración de sus productos, espera incrementar los platillos que elabora para ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes y permanecer en su preferencia.

Aurelia es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere hacer crecer su negocio, y ofrece pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a Aurelia, puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, tu ayuda será de gran bendición.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is married with one child. She runs a retail shop near her residence selling different consumable items, especially food. She lives in Vituka Dar es Salaam. She is facing stiff competition from nearby shops. Due to her limited capital she frequently has trouble maintaining sufficient stock on her shelves.

To improve her competitiveness she is in need of USD 550 to increase her working capital. The amount will be used to add stock of some items especially those with high turnover.

loans.use: Expand retain business selling food and other consumables.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth M. is married and has 2 sons, ages 9 and 11. Her husband, Anselmo, is a bricklayer in Monterrey in Nuevo León state, where both come from. Ruth took a course offered by one of the government's programs, and she was granted a scholarship. With the knowledge she obtained, she started to make and sell tamales, tacos and home-made food a year ago. She sells her products to the stores that are near her house.

There has been an increase in her number of clients and they have started to ask for more variety, thus Ruth needs a $200 loan. She will repay it within 3 to 6 months. Now is the moment to help, you can contribute to this family's growth! Ruth is sincerely grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Ruth M. es casada y tiene dos hijos de 9 y 11 años, su esposo Anselmo es albañil en la ciudad de Monterrey, en el estado de Nuevo León de donde ambos son originarios. Ruth tomó un curso en uno de los programas que realiza el gobierno del Estado, donde le otorgaron una beca, con estos conocimientos ella inició con la elaboración y venta de tamales, tacos y comidas caseras, desde hace un año, ofreciendo sus comidas en los negocios que se ubican cerca de su casa.

Ahora sus clientes se han incrementado y le han pedido más variedad en sus alimentos, para lo que Ruth requiere de un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que utilizará con este fin, ella se compromete a retornar esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Ahora es momento de ayudar, tú puedes colaborar a mejorar la vida de esta familia, Ruth agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Compra de insumos

loans.name: Zaila

texts.en:
Zaila lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. She is married and has two sons. Zaila is a food vendor. She operate this business in a rented premise in a busy industrial area. Most of her customers are industrial workers. She has four years in this business.

She wants to improve her business by adding dining tables and chairs, food serving dishes and stock of cold drinks. She also in need of a cupboard for keeping food serving dishes hygienically. During working hours her business is normally crowded with customers. Sometimes she looses customers due to her limited facilities. To facilitate her plan Zaila needs USD 750.

loans.use: Buy equipment and furniture for restaurant

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.en:
Mrs. M. I. is married and has three children, ages 8, 9 and 14. She is originally from San Luís Potosí, but now lives with her family in Monterrey. Her husband is a construction worker, and his salary can't pay for all the family's needs. For some time, Hortencia wanted to help her husband with family expenses, but didn't know how she could help. A year ago, she was offered work in diaper sales, and she has been doing that ever since. Her business has now borne fruits, and she has a job on a mobile market.

Now Hortencia wants to maker her business grow and is asking for a loan of $200 that will enable her to buy incontinence products for adults, which is in the most demand from her clients. You can help contribute to improve this family's quality of life and support Hortencia. She is sincerely grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Translator

La señora Hortencia es casada y tiene tres hijos de 8, 9 y 14 años, ella es originaria de San Luís Potosí, pero ahora vive con si familia en Monterrey, Nuevo León. Su esposo es albañil y el salario que recibe no cubre todas las necesidades de su familia, hace tiempo Hortencia quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, pero no sabía de que manera, hace un año recibió la invitación a trabajar en la venta de pañales y la aceptó. Su negocio ahora le ha rendido frutos y tiene un puesto en un mercado rodante.

Ahora Hortencia quiere hacer crecer su negocio y solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares que empleará la compra de pañales para adulto que es lo que más demandan sus clientes. Tú puedes contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, apoya a Hortencia, ella agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Buy diapers for resale.

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.en:
Maria de la Luz has two children, ages 3 and 7. Her husband, Alejandro, is a taxi driver, so he doesn't have a fixed salary and often doesn't make enough to meet all the family's needs. To make a little more income and improve the conditions her family lives in, Maria began to sell shoes through catalogues six years ago. She has since started selling jewelry as well, and through this has been able to help Alejandro with family expense and educate the children.

Maria's clients have increased, and she has not been apply to carry out some of their orders due to a lack of capital. Because of this, she needs a loan of $150, which she will be able to repay in three to six months, that will enable her to execute all orders. Supporting Maria will help improve her and her family's quality of life. They are thankful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Translator

Maria de la Luz tiene dos hijos, de 3 y 7 años, su esposo Alejandro es taxista por lo que no tiene un salario fijo y le era insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, de esta manera Maria empezó a vender zapatos por catálogo desde hace seis años, para obtener un poco más de ingreso y mejorar las condiciones en las que vivían ella y su familia. Después inició también con la venta de joyería, y de esta forma Mary ayuda a su esposo con los gasto del hogar y de la educación de sus hijos.

Los clientes de Mary se han incrementado y muchos de los pedidos no los ha podido surtir, por la falta de capital para invertir, para esto necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 150 dólares que empleara con este fin, que esta dispuesta a regresar en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Apoya a Maria de la Luz, tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu ayuda.

loans.use: Buy shoes and jewelry

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos started selling tacos in his own home six years ago. Little by little, clients and demand for his product increased. A little while ago, he took his earnings and bought a trailer that allowed him to set up his business along the main streets of the city, creating a larger market for his tacos and the possibility to increase sales. But he spent all he had and now needs a loan of $925 that will allow him to buy ingredients to make his tacos.

Carlos is a hard worker and he promises to repay the loan within six months to a year. His daughter works alongside him at the taco stand, and with the two of them working together they are confident the business will grow. You have the opportunity to help them, and your support will be very useful. They are sincerely grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Translator

El señor Carlos, inició con la venta de tacos hace seis años, en su propio domicilio, poco a poco fueron incrementándose los clientes y la demanda por sus productos. Hace poco utilizó las ganancias que tenía para comparar un remolque que le permite ubicarse en una de las principales avenidas para cubrir un mercado más amplio, e incrementar sus ventas. Pero gastó todo lo que tenia y ahora necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 dólares que utilizará para la compra de insumos que requiere para la elaboración de los tacos.

Carlos es un hombre muy trabajador y se compromete a regresar el préstamo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses, su hija colabora con él en la taquería y con el trabajo de los dos confían en que su negocio podrá crecer. Tú tienes la posibilidad de ayudarlos, tu apoyo será de gran utilidad para ellos y te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Buy taco ingredients

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.en:
Maria Dolores is originally for San Nicolás de los Garza in the state of Nuevo León. She started a haberdashery five years ago and has seen it grow little by little. From her experience, she knows the most sold products and she has tried to supply these necessities to her clients. She currently needs a $475 loan to buy a refrigerator, because she needs to incorporate the sale of frozen treats into her business. The warm season, when these products are in high demand, is beginning and she wants to be prepared.

Through hard work Maria has been able to move her business and her family forward. The continued growth of her shop and the well-being of her family are in your hands. Make the decision to support them.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria Dolores es originaria de la ciudad de San Nicolás de los Garza en el estado de Nuevo León, hace cinco años inició con su negocio de mercería y ha visto crecer poco a poco su negocio, por la experiencia que tiene en este negocio ya conoce los productos que más se venden y ella ha tratado de suplir las necesidades de sus clientes. Actualmente necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares para la compra de un refrigerador que necesita para incorporar en su negocio la venta de nieve, ya que esta por iniciar la temporada en que se incrementan las ventas de este producto, y quiere estar preparada.

El arduo trabajo de la señora Maria ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio y a su familia. En tus manos esta el crecimiento de esta mercería y el bienestar de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Rufet

texts.en: Rufet M. owns a small audio cassette and CD shop in the small town of Khachmaz, located on the Northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Rufet wants to invest in a larger inventory for his store so that he can fill up his new displays that he has recently acquired. He also wants to purchase CD players to sell in order to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase CD players to sell and to increase his inventory of music.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is a very active and responsible woman. She started selling lingerie and shoes 10 years ago to help educate her three children, ages 10, 17 and 20. Her husband is a gas truck driver and his income is not enough to cover the family's basic necessities. Orders for the products Marisa sells have increased, but she has not been able to execute all her clients' orders due to the low amount of capital she has. For this reason she needs a loan of $475.

It has not been easy for Marisa to last for so long in her business, but the incentive of a good education for her children has motivated her to keep going from day to day, looking out for the well-being of her family. You can help improve the quality of life of her family if you help her. Marisa and her family are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Marisa es una mujer muy activa y responsable, inició con la venta de lencería y zapatos hace diez años, para apoyar a su esposo con la educación de sus tres hijos, de 20, 17 y 10 años, su esposo trabaja como operador en un camión repartidor de gas y su ingreso no le permitía cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. Se han incrementado los pedidos de los productos que comercializa Marisa, pero el poco capital que ella tiene no le ha permitido cubrir las demandas de sus clientes. Para esto necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que utilizará con este fin.

No ha sido fácil para Mariza conservarse por tanto tiempo en su negocio, pero el incentivo de la educación de sus hijos la ha impulsado a seguir día a día, buscando el bienestar de su familia. Tú puedes mejorar las condiciones en las que vive esta familia, no lo dudes más y ayuda a Marisa, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy lingerie and shoes

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria has a 16-year-old son and two daugthers, ages 14 and 11. Sadly in 2003 her husband died, leaving her in charge of the three kids with no means of income. To keep her family together and give the children an education, Maria decided to start a convenience store, and little by little the business has grown. Recently she put in video games at the store. Her son helps her run the business in the mornings before going to school. It has been difficult for this family to deal with the loss of their father and overcome all of the family expenses, but by sticking together and working they have been able to move ahead.

Currently, Maria Victoria needs a loan of $475 to purchase merchandise to expand the product selection at the store and to increase profits. You can help improve this family's quality of life. They need your help and would appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Victoria tiene un hijo D. 16 años D. edad y dos hijas D. 14 y 11. En el año 2003 lamentablemente falleció su esposo, dejándola a cargo D. sus tres hijos, sin ningún tipo D. ayuda económica, por la necesidad D. mantener a su familia y darles educación Maria decidió iniciar con su negocio D. abarrotes y poco a poco ha ido creciendo, recientemente incorporó el servicio D. videojuegos. Su hijo mayor es quien le ayuda en su negocio por las mañanas antes D. irse a la escuela. Ha sido difícil para esta familia sobreponerse a la pérdida D. su padre y sobretodo a superar los gastos, pero con la unión D. la familia y el trabajo D. todos han podido salir adelante.

En estos momentos, Maria Victoria necesita D. un préstamo por la cantidad D. $ 475 dólares que utilizara en la compra D. mercancía con la finalidad D. incrementar la variedad D. productos que ofrece y poder obtener un mayor beneficio. Tú puedes mejorar las condiciones en que se encuentra esta familia, ellos necesitan D. tu ayuda, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Buy products to sell at the convenience store.

loans.name: Sandra Elva

texts.en:
Sandra is an active, enterprising young woman with big dreams of getting ahead in the business world. She ran a small gift shop that she had to sell in a time of need. To earn income, she started selling shoes in her hometown of Saltillo, Coahuila, two years ago. Since then, the clients have grown along with the orders. Since she's selling retail, she wants to execute larger orders, which will help earn more profits.

Sandra has an opportunity to start selling wholesale, but she does not have sufficient funds to cover the costs, which is why she's asking for a $275 loan that she will repay within three to six months. She needs your help. Make yourself a part of her dream and support her.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Sandra es una joven emprendedora muy activa y con grandes deseos de superación, ella tenía una pequeña tienda de regalos que por necesidad tuvo que traspasar, y para obtener ingresos empezó con la venta de zapatos hace dos años, en la localidad de Saltillo del estado de Coahuila, de donde es originaria. Desde que empezó hasta ahora los clientes se han incrementado al igual que los pedidos, y mas que vender a menudeo, ella quiere surtir grandes pedidos, porque sabe que de esta manera podrá obtener mejores beneficios.

Se ha presentado la oportunidad que ella esperaba de vender en mayoreo, pero Sandra no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para cubrir los pedidos, por lo que solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 275 dólares, que esta dispuesta a regresar en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Ella necesita de tu ayuda, conviértete en parte importante de sus sueños, y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Buy shoes for retail sale.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.en:
Gabino is married and has four children, ages 30, 28, 25 and 14. He started his convenience store in 1990. He worked for the defense department and for his job had to be away from the city for long periods. His wife and kids ran the business while he was away to help settle family and school expenses. In 1997, Gabino dedicated himself full-time to his store and purchased a copier, a refrigerator for drinks and milk products, and a counter in order to offer a better-quality service to his customers, and now the business is growing.

With the new acquisitions he has made to improve the store, Gabino doesn't have the capital to invest in merchandise, and he is asking for a $925 loan to meet this objective and help his business grow. He needs your help and appreciates whatever support you can offer.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Gabino es casado y tiene cuatro hijos de 30, 28, 25 y el menor de 14 años de edad. Inició su negocio de abarrotes en 1990, él trabajaba en la Secretaria de la Defensa Nacional y por su empleo tenia que estar fuera de la ciudad por largos periodos, por lo que su esposa y sus hijos emprendieron este negocio para solventar los gastos del hogar y la escuela, en 1997 Don Gabino se dedicó por completo a su abarrote y compraron una copiadora, un refrigerador para refrescos y lácteos, y un mostrador, con los que pudieron ofrecer mejores servicios a sus clientes, y ahora su negocio ha estado creciendo.

Con las nuevas adquisiciones que han hecho para mejorar el negocio, Don Gabino se ha quedado sin capital para invertir en mercancía, por lo que requiere de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que utilizará con este fin, para hacer crecer su negocio. Don Gabino necesita de tu ayuda, y agradece cualquier apoyo que puedas ofrecerle.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for convenience store

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Mrs. Felisa lives in the Villa Nueva Potosi neighborhood on a hillside to the East of the city of La Paz. She rents her house and lives with her husband and her son. She is 31 years old, and sells various products such as blouses, jackets, pants, sports clothing and jewelry. She has been involved in this work for more than ten years. This is not direct sales, she takes orders, makes deliveries and gets payments daily. Due to her previous history with this institution it is recommended that she be granted this credit since she is self-employed and this work provides her with her only income.

Translated from Spanish by Dwight Davis, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Felisa vive en la zona Villa Nueva Potosí, ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, en una casa alquilada cuya renta mensual es de Bs.250.oo (Doscientos cincuenta 00/100 Bolivianos), con su esposo y su hijo. Tiene 31 años de edad y se dedica a la venta al por menor de diferentes clases de productos como ser blusas, chompas, pantalones, zapatos, buzos deportivos, chamarras e incluso joyas. Realiza esta actividad casi mas de 10 años, este trabajo no es de venta directa ella acomoda las prendas y realiza el cobro todos los días en un monto fluctuante entre Bs. 5 y Bs. 10 por prenda colocada. Por su antecedente histórico con la Institución se recomienda otorgarle el crédito ya que su actividad es de autoempleo y le proporciona el único ingreso que ella tiene.

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is 45 years old and a single mother with 6 children. Without any formal education, she has been in fishmongering for over 10 years. As a single mother she has gone through a lot to educate some of her children through the basic level. She seeks to use the KIVA loan to procure a smoking oven made of wire net which can smoke 3 to 5 tiers of fish at a time. She hopes to increase her profit margin and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Mrs. Sofia lives in the house of her parents with her husband and children in the Alto San Pedro neighborhood of of La Paz, since her income isn't enough to permit her to rent a dwelling. She is 38 years of age and has a business of selling sandwiches of pork at the Hernando Siles de La Paz Stadium, during professional soccer matches. She also sells her products during concerts, folkloric events and other events that take place at different venues. On ordinary days, that is to say not on holidays or Sundays, she sells by walking around the city in the company of her husband and children, her nuclear family that keeps the business moving forward since that is their only source of income. Her trust in the institution and her history of paying back should permit her to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Dwight Davis, Kiva Volunteer. La señora Sofía vive en casa de sus padres con su esposo e hijos (zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz) pues sus ingresos no le permiten alquilar una vivienda. Tiene 38 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de sándwich de carne de cerdo en el estadium Hernando Siles de La Paz(durante los partidos de fútbol profesional). También realiza la venta de su producto en conciertos, entradas folklóricas y otras actividades que convocan a varios espectadores y participantes.
